Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    A Card Object that holds both a suit and value.
    Author:
    Arthur Bonini

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(CardSuit suit,
            CardValue value)
        Creates a new Card based on a user submitted suit and value.
        Parameters:
        suit - the card suit [Clubs, Diamonds, Hearts, Spades]
        value - the card value [Two-Ten, Jack, Queen, King, Ace]

      • Card

        public Card(int cardNum)
        Creates a new card based on the based on a number from 0 to 51. 0-12: Two to Ace (Clubs), 13-25: Two to Ace (Diamonds), 26-38: Two to Ace (Hearts), 39-51: Two to Ace (Spades)
        Parameters:
        cardNum - The card sequence number

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the Card [ex. 'Ace of Spaces', 'Two of Hearts'].
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the Card.

      • getSymbol

        public java.lang.String getSymbol()
        Returns a string representation of the Card using unicode symbols
        Returns:
        A string representation of the Card using symbols.

      • winner

        public boolean winner(Card c)
        Indicates whether another card has a higher value than this one. From lowest to highest: 2-A, Suit precedence: Clubs, Diamonds, Hearts, Spades.
        Parameters:
        c - the Card to compare too.
        Returns:
        true if this Card has a higher value than c, false if they are the same value or this one is less

      • getValue

        private double getValue()
        Returns a numeric value for a card based on its suit and card number.
        Returns:
        a numeric value based on the card suit and number
